content: I would like your opinion on that one. Should we change a < b on prod to mean a.1 < b.1 ∧ a.2 ≤ b.2 ∨ a.1 ≤ b.1 ∧ a.2 < b.2, or should this characterization be a lemma?
I think that we should not rely on definitional equalities for things like prod.has_lt, so I think that this should be a lemma.
I'd make the argument that that definition isn't really much more natural or easier to work with than the existing one, so there's not much point changing it
So should I change it to a lemma?
